column4: how do i make X forwarding over ssh possible? it says /usr/bin/X11/xauth:  error in locking authority file
i want the ssh connections to share x
ssh -X <remotemachine>
doesnt work
when i try to run an X app
the server has to allow it from the sshd_config
are you the same user on the server and remote?
no
thats the issue
i have to set up an account for each person i want to access X ?
I dont know, I dont think so but I dont know how to do it otherwise
your local xserver is having an issue with trying to run a program as the suer on the server side
on another topic, do you really want numerous people sshing to the sam account on a server?
i want to be able to ssh from one box to another, with different accounts
hmmm I just did it and it worked for me
try opening an X app
yes it works for me
hang on
I think at some point I modded my ~/.Xauthority file
mkxauth is still useful for transferring .Xauthority information to remote login sessions so that the user can display remote X clients on the local host without too much trouble.
do some googling, youll figure it out
Im sorry I done remember the details
